intro: Cyclophorus stigmosus, commonly known as the slender cyclophorus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
